event.title: summer tourist destination, Portsmouth was the home of the Strategic Air Command's Pease Air Force Base, later converted

data.event: A historic seaport and popular summer tourist destination, Portsmouth was the home of the Strategic Air Command's Pease Air Force Base, later converted to Portsmouth International Airport at Pease with limited commercial air service.

event.title: inhabited the territory of coastal New Hampshire for thousands of years

data.event: Native Americans of the Abenaki and other Algonquian languages-speaking nations, and their predecessors, inhabited the territory of coastal New Hampshire for thousands of years before European contact.

event.title: was settled by English colonists in 1630

data.event: The west bank of the harbor was settled by English colonists in 1630 and named Strawbery Banke, after the many wild strawberries growing there.

event.title: were imported as laborers as early as 1645

data.event: Enslaved Africans were imported as laborers as early as 1645 and were integral to building the city's prosperity.
